+1 to negotiation. For example, I want to add support for SIGWINCH which will require a new stream for exec, and that obviously won't work for older clients.
waiting here means a hung stdout/stderr stream can keep us from returning, even if we encountered an error
That was the original intended behaviour. What do you suggest instead of waiting?

more noting the change than objecting to it... I like waiting for all three streams, but I wasn't sure if there was a situation where an error propagated via the errorStream was expected to exit early and save us from a hung stderr/stdout stream
